Description: Fragment of lid of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis; glazed shiny black inside, a narrow added red line 0.9 cm from bottom break. Outside, facing out, black-figure boar hunt; preserved, the middle part of a cuirassed hunter to right leaning forward over the boar, whose ear, neck, shoulder, and back bristles remain; red for the chiton of the youth, the neck of the boar.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 84 no. 281 pl. 63)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2094)
